subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: Ken Macha was hired as the manager of the Milwaukee Brewers, taking over from Dale Sveum after the team’s first postseason appearance since 1982. Macha, 58, took the Oakland A’s to two American League West titles and lost his job after the 2005 season for a week, only to return in 2006. He spent the last two years as a television analyst. Sveum became interim manager when Ned Yost was fired with 12 games left in the regular season. Sveum is expected to return to the coaching staff.
